name: places/ChIJ26BPgY5ZwokRki1bHF4JK7Y
adrFormatAddress: 190 Bowery, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Skateboards & related gear, sneakers & house-brand streetwear make this SoHo shop a skater mecca.

originalText.text: First off.  It’s NYC. It’s busy.  A wait is anywhere.  Not Supreme.  Second. Clothing is like the online checkout on the website  on Release.  Next. Nice simple environment inside.  Minimal with the proper selection. I enjoyed my stop by the shop.  Purchased a new shirt.  Baseball. Camacho pin and already had some items.  But loved the vibe. The store and items.

text.text: First off.  It’s NYC. It’s busy.  A wait is anywhere.  Not Supreme.  Second. Clothing is like the online checkout on the website  on Release.  Next. Nice simple environment inside.  Minimal with the proper selection. I enjoyed my stop by the shop.  Purchased a new shirt.  Baseball. Camacho pin and already had some items.  But loved the vibe. The store and items.

originalText.text: This is a great place for any skater or even just people who want to get some NYC culture before they go. The had a great selection of clothes and boards plus a bunch of free stickers. The only downside is the line.

text.text: This is a great place for any skater or even just people who want to get some NYC culture before they go. The had a great selection of clothes and boards plus a bunch of free stickers. The only downside is the line.

originalText.text: I’ve been buying Supreme online for years and today was the first time I was in an actual store location. First glance at the building really just takes you away, it’s better in person than in pictures or videos. A small line was already formed when I got there, but I was able to get into the store under 15-20 minutes. Also,  the traffic at the corner where the store is situated at can get a little hectic, so keep that in mind if you plan to take pictures of the exterior (aka, be on a sidewalk). That being said, employees don’t allow photographing inside the store. They make it very clear either when you get yelled at or someone else does, lol. Inside the store looks amazing, really bright and (somewhat??) minimalistic. A deck wall complements the back of house. As for the products, I was surprised that Supreme carries other skate branded clothing. I was also taken aback by how much product they have in stock from past weekly releases and even past seasons. Keep in mind I went during sale season so that might have to do something with it, but most of the clothes were stuff that nobody wanted to buy (at least for full price) during the season, which might explain the return of some items. You also aren’t charged sales tax for items that are on sale. Definitely an essential visit if you’re touring NYC, or are looking to build your collection.

originalText.text: Some of the staff are unbothered but one of them was so helpful to me I wish I knew his name. Thank you for helping me get the items I wanted and also bringing some that I missed on the rack that you think I would love! Can't wait to go back again. Wish they had more chairs to put your stuff while trying on or maybe dressing rooms ?

originalText.text: If you are into Supreme it may be worth the wait. Try on a weekday to avoid the line. It could take a half hour to get in. Once inside the product of is limited and the store keeps the shopper numbers down on purpose for a feeling of exclusivity. Most purchases available online. Great staff inside.
